choices.name: Get started with research for your Utah ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for Utah ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for Utah research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Utah research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Utah Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Follow this research study for Utah ancestors, from 1850 to 1905.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Utah Research, 1850-1905

  3. Ancestry: Explore resources for Utah research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Utah Resources
    ☆ AC—Utah State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  4. Record Finder: Use the Utah Record Selection Table to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Utah Record Selection Table

  5. Read this overview article on Utah research.

    ☆ RIV—Utah Research

    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

  6. Find additional resources for Utah research.

    ☆ RT—Utah: Connect with the Crossroads of the West

Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Ethnic
  1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Utah in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Utah
    ☆ FS—Wiki: Utah Minorities

  2. Explore the African American Gateway for Utah.
  3. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Utah in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Utah

1. Explore Utah historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Utah History

  2. Explore Utah history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Utah

  3. Learn about Utah history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ Utah History

choices.name: Learn about Utah archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Utah archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Utah Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Utah State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Learn about the Utah State Archives.

    ☆ FS—10 Amazing Facts about the Utah State Archives
    ☆ FL—A Visit to the Utah Archives

  3. Watch this video for a tour of the Utah State Archives.

    ☆ RT—Tour of the Utah State Archives—13:53


  4. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Utah.
  5. Explore the Utah Dept. of Archives collection.
  6. Explore the Utah State History site.
  7. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Utah genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  8. Search for ☆free online books on Utah research on the FamilySearch site.
  9. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

QUIKLinks

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find Utah ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Utah city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Utah Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Utah city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Utah city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Utah ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Utah city directories records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  7. Find resoources for Utah city and town records on the Utah Division of Archives and Records Services site.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Utah County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Utah.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Utah Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Utah Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Utah Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Utah Valley Technology and Genealogy Group on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. West Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Utah.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Utah research.
  2. Explore the Utah research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore the ☆FamilySearch community for help with Utah research.
  4. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Utah research.

choices.name: Learn about Utah genealogy and historical societies.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Utah in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Utah Societies

  2. Explore the Utah Historical Society site.
  3. Explore the Utah Genealogical Society site.

  4. Explore Utah genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  5. Get help at a family history center in Utah.
